Understate: The claim may understate the significance of the increase in the matric pass rate. It only mentions the percentage increase without providing additional context or analysis.
Lack enough support: Without additional supporting evidence or data, it is unclear how the matric pass rate increased from 60.6 percent in 2009 to 75.1 percent last year. The claim lacks enough supporting information.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not provide any alternative explanations or factors that may have contributed to the increase in the matric pass rate. It could be useful to consider other possible factors that may have influenced the increase.
